intro: Pleroma caetanoi, commonly known as the red-flowered pleroma, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stems, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Pleroma caetanoi is valued in horticulture for its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various garden conditions.
